refnamediv.refpurpose: A virtual filesystem that allows access of groups of files as if they were a single large one

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: concat-fuse is a FUSE based filesystem that allows accessing groups of files, selected by a glob pattern, as if they were a single large file. In most cases direct interaction with concat-fuse isn't needed, as the convinience tool vcat hides the plumbing away.

refsect1.title: Structure
refsect1.para: The filesystem, once mounted, provides a single subdirectory named by-glob/. Accessing non-existing files in that directory will create a virtual files that will act as if it contained the concatenated data of the individual files. The individual files will be aquired by interpreting the filename as a glob pattern.
The glob pattern itself has to be provided in URL encoded manner, meaning "/" replaced with "%2f" and so on.
